Class EncodingSuite

java.lang.Object
EncodingSuite
public class EncodingSuite
extends java.lang.Object
Class Encoding Suite Handles the tasks of collecting user input, encoding, and decoding. Also includes the main looping method that allows for user interaction
Version:
2/11/2021
Author:
Peter Mertka

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    EncodingSuite()  

  • Method Summary

    Identical to arrayToString method from keyFile class, needed so that when the position is updated in a key file, the key itself is also rewritten
    private boolean checkIfStringValid​(java.lang.String test)
    Error checking method that is meant to test if a string contains punctuation or not for file creation Prevents users from entering strings with invalid characters for files to prevent errors

  • Constructor Details

    • EncodingSuite

      public EncodingSuite()

  • Method Details

    • createKeyFile

      public void createKeyFile​(int n, java.lang.String whatToNameFile)
      Allows for the creation of a key file given a length of key N and a string of what to name the file Creates a new keyFile Object
      Parameters:
      n - Interger: how long the key should be when the file is genereated in terms of # of numbers
      whatToNameFile - String: what the user wants to call their key File

    • createMessageFile

      public void createMessageFile​(int n, java.lang.String encodedMessage, java.lang.String messageFileName)
      Allows the encoder to create a new messageFile taking in a start position of the encrpytion, and what the encoded message is
      Parameters:
      n - Integer: The position in the key where the message began encryption
      encodedMessage - String: The encoded message after being translated by the encoder
      messageFileName - String: The chosen name of the messageFile as chosen by the user

    • getValidIntInput

      private int getValidIntInput()
      Error checking and user input retrieving function. Gets a valid integer input from the user, that is greater than 1
      Returns:
      Integer: "i", the valid integer input as chosen by the user

    • checkIfStringValid

      private boolean checkIfStringValid​(java.lang.String test)
      Error checking method that is meant to test if a string contains punctuation or not for file creation Prevents users from entering strings with invalid characters for files to prevent errors
      Parameters:
      test - String: The userInput gotten from the getValidStringInput Function
      Returns:
      Boolean returnVal: a variable that returns true if the string can be used for filename, false otherwise

    • getValidStringInput

      private java.lang.String getValidStringInput()
      Similar to getValidIntInput, gets a valid string to user for filenames from the user. Prevents the entry of file names with punctuation
      Returns:
      String a: the valid string as entered by the user

    • arrayToString

      private java.lang.String arrayToString​(int[] keyVals)
      Identical to arrayToString method from keyFile class, needed so that when the position is updated in a key file, the key itself is also rewritten
      Parameters:
      keyVals - Integer Array: The array containing all of the key values as integers
      Returns:
      String convertedString: The string representation of the key, as a list of comma separated values

    • encode

      private java.lang.String encode​(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String filepath, int[] keyVals, int start)
      Main encoding method, takes in a keyFile and message and converts it to the encoded form of message, also updates the keyPosition in the key file txt
      Parameters:
      message - String: what message the user wants to convert to a secret message
      filepath - String: the filepath of the keyFile method so that it can be accessed and rewritten to
      keyVals - Integer Array: an array of the integer values of the key from the key file
      start - Integer: where the encoding algorithm should begin to encrypt the message
      Returns:
      String encodedMessage: The string of the encoded message after encryption

    • decode

      private void decode​(java.lang.String encodedMessage, int[] keyVals, int start)
      Similar to encode, but works backwards. Takes an encoded messageFile and the keyFile used to encrypt it,and decodes the message while printing it
      Parameters:
      encodedMessage - String: the encoded message as taken from the messageFile
      keyVals - IntegerArray: the key values as taken from the keyFile, used to decrypt
      start - Integer: Where the encrption code last used a value to encode, allowing decoding program to work backwards

    • runSuite

      public void runSuite()
      Main looping function of the program, where all other methods are called from. Loop to allow users to make multiple actions Runs until user chooses to end the process.
